wikipedia_page.main:
Jan Marsh is a British writer and curator who is an expert on the Victorian period and particularly the Pre-Raphaelites and William Morris.
Marsh is president of the William Morris Society, a trustee of the William Morris Gallery and a fellow of the Royal Historical Society.

response: The first solo exhibition of Siddal's work was curated by Jan Marsh in 1991at the Ruskin Gallery in Sheffield.
Critic Jan Marsh suggests that the studio with the bull's eye windows may have been in Edward Burne-Jones's house "The Grange" in Fulham.
*A Guide to Victorian and Edwardian Portraits. London: National Portrait Gallery in association with the National Trust, 2011. (With Jan Marsh)
* "Vénus africaine: race, beauty and African-ness," [chapter] Black Victorians: black people in British art, 1800–1900, ed. Jan Marsh (Aldershot, Hampshire; Burlington, VT: Lund Humphries, 2005).
